summary: The Star of David, a six-pointed star made of two triangles, is a well-known symbol of Jewish identity and Judaism. It has been used for decorative and mystical purposes for centuries, appearing in ancient Jewish sites and texts. In the 17th century, it became a distinctive symbol for Jews and their religion, especially in Eastern Europe. The star gained international recognition as a Jewish symbol after World War I and is now the central emblem on Israel's flag, representing the Jewish people and their state.
title: Star of David
